snippet: The automaker told federal regulators it would replace potentially defective airbags in regions outside the high-humidity areas in which a formal recall was issued.
abstract: Honda announces it will replace potentially defective airbag inflaters from manufacturer Takata in cars nationwide, and not just in high-humidity areas; says recall is not being formally expanded.

byline.contributor: Christopher Jensen and Aaron M. Kessler contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The automaker told federal regulators it would replace potentially defective airbags in regions outside the high-humidity areas in which a formal recall was issued.

headline.main: Honda to Replace Airbags Throughout U.S.
headline.print_headline: Honda to Replace Airbags Throughout U.S.
